Education or Indoctrination in Texas?
The news from the nation's most influential state board of education is another reminder of the difficulty of creating a curriculum that passes muster with all stakeholders. In early March, the Texas board released its social studies standards
continuation: , which are expected to be adopted in May . Because the Texas market is so big ( 4 . 7 million students ) , no publisher dares to publish textbooks that don ' t conform to the stipulated standards .But the bigger matter here is the purpose of a curriculum , whether on a state or national level . Although Texas is the latest focus , the debate over what should be taught is not new .There has long been a tension between various groups . In 1925 , for example , Tennessee passed the Butler Act , which created it unconstitutional to teach " any theory that denies the story of the Divine Creation of man as teach in the Bible . "It was the basis for the Scopes " monkey trial " that drew nationwide attention . The law was finally repealed in 1967 , but the fight was not over .In 2005 , the U . S . District Court prevented the Dover Area School Board in Pennsylvania from teaching " intelligent design " in science classes , holding that the idea is creationism in disguise .

continuation: a widespread anticipation that this candidate would abandon Parliament and leave Canberra far behind , they have decided to stay put in their backbench seat , talking about the importance of serving their constituency . In fact , they occasionally seem to give more interviews and write more columns than the person who succeeded them .In these interviews , they profess a desire to assist the government while giving thinly veiled ( and sometimes not veiled at all ) criticisms of what the state is doing . They also appear in cheerful selfies with normal punters in regular circumstances to show what a regular man they are .But if you guessed Tony Abbott , you receive the prize . The member for Warringah is turning in to the former member for Griffith .Post - prime ministerial life is having a cloning effect . On paper , Abbott could not be further from Rudd .

input: World Sake Day or "Nihonshu no Hi" is a significant day on the Japanese calendar with celebrations held annually on 1 October. This date is considered "New Year's Day" for sake because it marks the first day of the sake
continuation: making season in Japan . October is the best time for sake cultivation as it is just after the harvest of sake rice , with the winter season that follows being the best season for fermentation .World Sake Day was making official in 1978 when it was recognised by the Japan Sake and Shochu Makers Association . World Sake Day festivities have since spread outside Japan with celebrations in major centers throughout North America and Europe .Tastings and special menus on 1 October in London include sake - inspired meals and cocktails at Sushisamba and tastings of 40 different sakes at Hedonism Wines . San Francisco claims to have to biggest World Sake Day festivities outside of Japan with a celebration at the Hotel Kabuki providing tastings of 200 sakes .In Tokyo , the annual World Sake Day festivities at the Palace Hotel Tokyo are memorable . input: You remember the tragic story about the murder of Chauncey Bailey, the editor of a weekly newspaper in Oakland, Calif., killed on Aug. 2 as he was walking to work. Police quickly made arrests following the slaying, which they think was
continuation: related to a critical article Bailey was working on about an Oakland organization accused of criminal activity . But not as much folks read about Bailey ' s burial , and about the motifs of love and hope delivered in his pastor ' s eulogy .I see it in a story by Jacob Buckenmeyer , and that ' s where the Christopher text got in . Let me share it with you .Chauncey Bailey was not only a parishioner of St . Benedict Catholic Church in Oakland ; he and the preacher , Father Jay Matthews , were the best of friends . Both men happen to be African - American , and the Oakland Post which Bailey authored primarily represents Oakland ' s black neighborhood .At the burial Mass on Aug . 8 , Father Matthews stressed that Bailey died attempting to make not only that neighborhood , but all of Oakland , a better spot to live . Apparently it was quite a ceremony .The congregation typically seats about 400 , but upwards of 700 people crowded inside that day . Hundreds more sat outside .

input: It's 75 years since Trotsky, already expelled from the Soviet Communist Party and exiled, went to start a new life in Mexico. But he was hunted down in Mexico City by Stalinist assassins, as his grandson, who was living with him when he

With " the Old Man " , as he affectionately calls his grandfather , " I eventually found somebody stable , though it did not last very long . "Speaking from the house in Mexico City where he resided with the exiled revolutionary and his second husband , Natalia , for more than a year before Trotsky ' s killing on 20 August 1940 , Volkov recounts his anticipation at arriving in the Americas from Europe . continuation: 1 billion users across the globe . What is end - to - end encryption ?Why should it matter to you ? WhatsApp  s end - to - end encryption feature essentially determines that only the sender and receiver can read what has been delivered .This implies nothing in between , including WhatsApp , can see the message transmitted . Basically , two keys , public and public , are produced when a user opens WhatsApp for the first time .The encryption process took place on your smartphone . input: In the coming days, much of the coverage of the Chernobyl disaster in Russia is likely to focus on the 30-year anniversary and commemorations of it. The same may be said of reporting in Ukraine and Belarus, countries directly affected by the ramifications
continuation: of Chernobyl . Fewer are likely to examine the present state of nuclear electricity in these nations or their industries  enduring weaknesses and defects  let alone advancements in terms of security .Several decades after a tragedy as critical as this one , it is important to question why a viable story for a post - atomic Russia , let alone a post - atomic Ukraine or Belarus , has failed to find traction and support in a region blighted by its nuclear heritage . Most of the commemorations and coverage following the Chernobyl anniversary are likely to overlook those in Russia supporting and fighting for such a narrative to secure acceptance in society , as well as the problems and dangers they must endure in doing so .Indeed , seldom has attacking the atomic industry and societal consensus in Russia been so difficult or hazardous : activists discover themselves squeezed within a political environment strongly supportive of nuclear electricity , while also operating amid escalating anti - NGO persecution and rhetoric . input: Twenty five years later, I met a student who was frustrated and disappointed about his life. I asked him the simple question, why? Then he began to express himself about what he wanted to achieve in his life. I was very impressed with his ambitions
continuation: . However , his priorities were wrong .He was a ninth grade student that wanted what he liked in his life right then . He needed a brand new vehicle to drive , and a huge house to live in , and he was very serious about what he desired .It ' s imperative for fathers to teach their sons delayed gratification . This young boy believed as a young adult , he should have lots of money in his pocket to be able to take his wife to the film cinema .He never see the process of school , then graduation . We then stared at what was most important right then and focused on some future goals .Delayed gratification is passing up small term earnings for long term reward . The capacity to halt gratification is a major indicator of achievement for kids and their parents .In our society , adults and kids alike are bombarded with the temptation to give in to short term gains . Parents should begin to teach their students the talent of delaying gratification early in their lives , as the previous parents

input: This years monster El Nio is truly a monsterits been blamed for killing coral reefs. Add another die-off to the list: Southern California beaches are blanketed in hundreds of thousands of tiny crabs. So many that
continuation: it  s making the coastline crimson . Pleuroncodes planipes , or tuna crabs ( although they  re not true crabs , they  re actually lobsters ) , are typically found in seas off the coast of Mexico  s Baja California , to the south .But as we know already , nothing about this year is normal , and the hotter seas of El Nio have washed the critters further north . The crabs presumably swarmed as they were trying to mate and were pushed ashore by violent currents . Typically such strandings of these species in large numbers are owing to hot water intrusions ,  according to Linsey Sala , from the Pelagic Invertebrates Collection at Scripps Institution of Oceanography at UC San Diego . The crabs are most intense on the Southern California shores of Orange County where beaches are covered in so several crustaceans that the coasts actually appear orange ( okay , perhaps a bright coral ) from the air .

input: If you are willing to take the time to calculate the needed calories to bulk up, the process should be relatively simple. Bulking up or building muscle means getting a mass stimulus from resistance-training and then supplying your body with adequate

Airlift of a Marine Corps battalion to Lebanon demonstrated that deploying contingency forces from the continental United States to an overseas operation was feasible and expeditious.
During the Cold War, the United States deployed its Armed Forces to support the national objectives of various
continuation: countries around the globe . The majority of those missions were short in duration and happened in underdeveloped areas of the world .Most were joint operations , and some were conducted with troops from allied countries . Nearly all of them were contingency operations in which the objectives , the time available , and the operational area were restricted .One such mission was Operation Bluebat , the code name for the U . S . military involvement in Lebanon in 1958 . That nation , which is situated between Israel and Syria , was threatened by a rebellion aimed at toppling its pro - Western state .Because the resources needed to deploy an airborne corps were restricted , Operation Bluebat was one of the most complex operations of the Cold War . The XVIII Airborne Corps at Fort Bragg , North Carolina , was designated as the Strategic Army Corps ( STRAC ) in 1958 .The designation was , in reality , the assignment of an additional mission rather than a true designation . The additional mission was to provide a flexible strike capability that could deploy

The fight against Ottawas proposed tax changes for small corporations isnt over, even after watered-down policies were proposed in the latest federal budget following months of business community backlash.
The Coalition for Small Business Tax Fairness, a
continuation: group formed to fight the federal government  s tax - reform proposals for private corporations last introduced last spring , is calling for more changes weeks before the amendments are expected to pass .  A lot of people , including a lot of politicians , think the small - business tax battle is over and that businesses are walking away satisfied . That  s not true ,  says Dan Kelly , president and CEO of the Canadian Federation of Independent Business ( CFIB ) , one of the more than 70 organizations behind the coalition . The organization wants Ottawa to halt proposed tax changes for incorporated small businesses around income splitting and passive assets , calling them unfair and citing broader global economic pressures .The specific changes include regulating the ability of tiny - business owners to  sprinkle  earnings to family members to reduce their taxes , as well as rules around using their companies as a vehicle for passive assets , such as stocks or real property that are unrelated to the company . This opinion piece is by Valarie Kaur, a civil rights lawyer, filmmaker, and interfaith leader who founded Groundswell, the nations largest multi-faith online organizing community.
Gunshots in a sanctuary of peace. C
continuation: ries of fear where people shout God  s name . Blood in the prayer hall .A community shaken by hate but come together to sing , pray and forgive even before they  ve lay the dead to rest . This is what happened three years previously in Oak Creek , Wis . , when a white supremacist opened fire in a Sikh house of worship on a Sunday morning and murdered six persons .It was one of the deadliest raids on a religious society in the United States since the 1963 Birmingham church attack that took four little girls  until Charleston . Monday is the day of the last funeral of the nine black Americans murdered in Mother Emanuel parish in Charleston , S . C .Since the shot , the nation has mourned together . Thousands have gathered in vigils , and nearly 10 , 000 have given prayers and messages of solidarity to Charleston .As a Sikh American who living through the aftermath of the shootings in Oak Creek , I have been shedding familiar tears . There are people who insist that Super Bowl Sunday or the Kentucky Derby is the most exciting day in sports. I always argue that there is no day in sports better than tomorrow. Nothing beats the Saturday of college basketball's Final Four.
There is still
continuation: something pure about this event that making it better . Maybe what makes the difference is all that undying collegiate loyalty , the knowledge that for the remainder of their lives , these kids will be true to their institutions .Or maybe I appreciate those unpaid experts out there on the court , playing their hearts out . Life will never get good for most of them .Whatever it is , my experiences of Final Four weekends are so vivid , so particular , that other sporting events pale in comparison . First brings the suspense of the Saturday doubleheader , with four teams assembled united like Agatha Christie mystery suspects .This is followed by the individual brilliance and human error of the Monday championship game , when you never know which kid is going to be hits by lightning - - someone becoming a hero , someone else made a awful mistake . input: Red Hat bought IT automation-centric configuration management DevOps-friendly firm Ansible, okay so we know that part. Retaining the Ansible brand and names as it does, this month sees Red Hat launch Ansible Container, but what is
continuation: it ? Offered as a software preview at this phase , Ansible Container works to create Docker - formatted Linux boxes within Ansible Playbooks .These so - called playbooks are Ansible  s layout , deployment and orchestration syntax . They can describe a strategy that a programmer wants a remote system to enforce , or a setting of steps in a general IT process .Playbooks are intended to be human - readable and are created in a basic text language . According to Greg DeKoenigsberg in his capacity as coordinator for the Ansible community , while standardisation is emerging for container formats in the form of the Open Container Initiative , Red Hat worries that the tooling space is already fragmented , with developers often forced to work outside of the enterprise workstream to create and install containerised apps .Ansible Container changes this dynamic ( so claims Red Hat ) , by bringing Linux container construction into the established workstream through the easy - to - consume Ansible Play

input: New Delhi: Prime Ministers Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP) is a credit-linked subsidy programme aimed at generating self-employment opportunities through establishment of micro-enterprises in the non-farm sector by helping traditional artisans and unemployed
continuation: youth . Any individual above 18 years of age is eligible .For set up of schemes costing above Rs . 10 lakh in the industrial sector and above Rs . 5 lakh in the commercial / service sector , the beneficiaries should possess at least VIII standard pass academic qualification .General category beneficiaries can avail of margin money subsidy of 25 % of the project cost in rural regions and 15 % in urban regions . For beneficiaries belonging to special categories such as scheduled caste / scheduled tribe / OBC / minorities / women , ex - serviceman , mentally handicapped , NER , Hill and Border regions etc .the margin funds subsidy is 35 % in rural regions and 25 % in urban regions . The Scheme was launched during 2008 - 09 .A total of 4 . 23 lakh micro companies have been assisted with a margin money subsidy of Rs 8695 . 27 crore providing employment to an estimated 35 . 48 lakh persons since 2008 - 09 till 2016 - 17 across the nation including the State of Maharashtra .

Employers rushing to automatically enroll workers in retirement plans and directing the money to one-stop life-cycle funds are leaving old-fashioned investment advice behind in a cloud of so much dust.
That may be a mistake, say advice providers, who
continuation: are trotting out achievement figures that appear to make the case for giving workers access to more advice , not less . While about half of workplace retirement schemes provide advice and an equal number automatically enroll workers into a default investment choice , the default system is the one with all the momentum , said David Wray , president of the Profit Sharing / 401 ( k ) Council of America in Chicago ." Companies are moving beyond advice and providing a default solution because guidance alone hasn ' t resulted in action , " Wray said . " Face - to - face advising is expensive , difficult to control and it ' s difficult to make sure all employees get the same , continuous experience . "Among the 45 percent of employers offering guidance , only a third of those workers are accessing that advice , and even fewer carry out the advice , according to the council , an association of about 1 , 200 company plans . " Ten years ago we all thought [ traditional advisory services ] might be large , but employers can ' t get people

input: In summertime, many women shelve their foundation and reach for beauty products that proffer a sheer, sun-kissed glow. In unpracticed hands, however, tinted moisturizers and bronzers can streak and pool faster than a
continuation: chalk mark in a rainstorm . Finding the right product for your flesh is just the start .Blending it is the next part . " You truly have to put the product through the test , " explained celebrity makeup artist Tomy Rivero , who has worked on the faces of Barbara Corcoran ( " Shark Tank " ) and Peter Dinklage ( " Game of Thrones " ) .Rivero suggests attending a cosmetic counter or beauty store at the start of a day when you know you will be out and about . Ask for a test application , or buying a travel size of one you ' d like to audition .Watch how it replies to fluctuations in heat and moisture . " Then and only then will you understand how the product wore on your flesh , " he said ." Do you have to powder , does it disappear , does it oxidize and shift tones ? input: What if the research agenda of the University of Texas College of Natural Sciences were drafted not by the professors who actually conduct the studies but by, say, the alumni who funded the department? We might end up with research on the stickiness of Mr.
continuation: Big  s brand of glue instead of the development of an AIDS vaccine . Luckily , most research schools don  t work that way .The federal government , however , occasionally does . In the Bush Administration , when the religious right or huge business weighs in on a issue of science , politics typically prevails .So while this President may lack the powerful eloquence of William Jennings Bryan , in the world of science he  s the modern equivalent of the Great Orator fighting the infidels of evolution in the Scopes Trial of 1925 . Scientific panels and committees have proven particularly susceptible to political distortion by the White House .In one revealing case , Bush & Co . intervened at the exact moment that the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention  s Advisory Committee on Childhood Lead Poisoning Prevention was set to consider once again lowering acceptable blood - lead concentrations in reaction to new scientific evidence . input: Most of mobile right now is focused on trying to figure out where the whales arethe big dollar advertising, says Jeffrey Peden. Seems to be an accurate statement, considering the big deal activity Boston has seen lately with major mobile
continuation: advertising startups . Not the case with his Cambridge , MA - based startup CraveLabs , whose technology lets not - so - technology - savvy local company owners market themselves on consumers  mobile machines .Peden was the head tech officer and founder of the wireless security tech group Newbury Networks and left about two years after the company was acquired by Trapeze Networks in 2008 . His father  s gig as the owner of a local video production company became as a source of inspiration for his upcoming venture .Facebook was a huge beginning place for Peden . About 70 percent of tiny business owners use the social platform to reach customers , updating their pages somewhere between daily and monthly , he said .So , rather than requiring business owners to use a distinct , sophisticated back ending system to move advertising into the wireless sphere , CraveLabs  program moves the text from customers  Facebook updates and converts it to mobile banner ad text , for $ 5 a day .

A quick run-through of basic measures of investment value for shares and stock markets.
The most widely used calculation, this ratio compares a companys value with its profits. To work it out, you take the share price and divide it
continuation: by the annual earnings - per - share figure . The smaller the figure , the cheaper the stock .This is the p / e ratio , but with a twist . Instead of using profits over 12 months , this measure takes the average earnings figure over the previous 10 years .The Cape ratio strips out short - term anomalies , acknowledging the criticism levelled at the p / e that it is based on a  snapshot  of companies  profitability , takes no account of the corporate cycle . It is often employed to value stock markets .Instead of looking at earnings , this ratio considers how a corporation  s market price compares with the value of its assets  the value of all the buildings , equipment and intangible assets if sold today . As with the other two measures , a low score signals that a stock market or share is undervalued , with a figure below one suggesting that the company is worth fewer than the sum of its parts .Dont forget to check

input: A new travel site called Rome2Rio launches today, the brainchild of two ex-Microsoft employees, Michael Cameron and Bernard Tschirren. The sites main innovation? Its vehicle agnostic, in a way
continuation: you tell it you want to going from A to B , and it  ll show you what combination of car , plane , railway , or ferry you need to take . In that manner , it  s more like the  how to getting there  in a Lonely Planet guide , points out VentureBeat in its story on the site today .Rather than piece together information from here and there , Rome2Rio aims for the all - inclusive experience of simply viewing a paragraph in a guidebook . Cameron and Tschirren told VentureBeat that the portal is probably most useful in Europe , where the train networks are complicated and have diverse pricing . The salesman, showman and visionary who dreamed up the Indianapolis 500 would be proud: The 100th running this weekend will host the first official sellout and one of its largest crowds to date.
But "Crazy" Carl G. Fisher --
continuation: an Elon Musk - level innovator of his era , mostly forgotten by history - - wouldn ' t have been satisfied . He was always looking for the next big thing .Fisher was a drove force behind the Indianapolis Motor Speedway , and later the development of the first interstate highways - - the Lincoln and the Dixie - - which opened vast swaths of the U . S . to travel by car . And he came on to develop Miami Beach out of swampland and the resort village of Montauk on Long Island , seeing his fortune swell as high as $ 100 million .Fisher losing most everything when the " Great Miami " hurricane struck in 1926 , and the stock price crashed in 1929 . He killed at 65 in 1939 ." He was going 100 miles per hour all the time , but never seemed to stay with anything for long , " added Donald Davidson , the Indianapolis Motor Speedway historian . " Fisher was an idea guy .He had a fire burning in his abdomen . " He also

input: As far as the authorities could tell, some of the younger members of the Fourth Reich Skinheads of Orange County had been hating Jews, blacks and other ethnic minorities for only less than a year. So maybe there was still time to reach them, offer
continuation: alternatives and save them from the destiny of their leaders , who faced years in Federal prison after trying to run a race war with homemade bombs . Although final results are not expected until later, the scale of the predicted victory is such that the ruling Congress party has admitted defeat.
BJP leader Narendra Modi tweeted: "India has won. Good times ahead."
This is the most resounding
continuation: victory for a political party in 30 centuries , said correspondents . Mr Modi , previously chief minister of the western state of Gujarat , is seen as a no - nonsense , can - do leader who stood for development and muscular nationalism , the BBC said .He fought on promises of a revival in financial growth . But many Indians still have profound concerns over Mr Modi because of allegations he did nothing to halt the 2002 communal violence in Gujarat , in which at least 1 , 000 persons died , most of them Muslims - allegations he has always denied and over which he was seldom convicted .The election result will be a crushing blow to the Congress party , which is led by the Nehru - Gandhi family and has dominated Indian politics since independence . High tide has passed in Cork city without flooding although a flood warning remains in place for part of the city centre during tomorrow morning's high tide.

continuation: on Morrison ' s Island , Union Quay , Wandesford Quay and Crosses Green . The council claims it expects the main impact of any flooding will be on parking and on traffic .As the clean - up following Storm Eleanor continues , the National Emergency Co - ordination Group met this morning to review the situation . Group Chair Sean Hogan said it was also looking at helping residents to deal with the situation in Galway , where parts of the cities suffered serious flooding .Mr Hogan said they must evaluate the warnings that were given following complaints in Galway that residents were not sufficiently notified of flooding . He said there was an orange level weather warning from Met ireann in place , which included a warning of coastal flooding and strong tides .Mr Hogan said that while the storm had been anticipated , what may have took people by surprise was the extent and speed of what happened in Galway . Jacksonville High School girls soccer coach John Mansholt will be coaching the MacMurray College mens soccer team this fall as well.
Mansholt is one of two new Highlander soccer coaches. MacMurray hired Andrew Len
continuation: hardt , longtime head soccer manager at Benedictine University in Springfield , to coach the women  s team . Mansholt will continue to coach the JHS girls  soccer team , just as he has for the previous 18 years .The high school women  soccer season is competed in the spring , so it won  t clash with the fall college season . input: PHILADELPHIA  Today, electrophysiologists from Penn Medicine implanted the regions first subcutaneous implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) for sudden cardiac arrest, a potentially fatal electrical malfunction
continuation: of the heart . The patient , a young athletic male in his 20s , had the new system implanted during an outpatient operation at the Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania ( HUP ) . input: We all take inspiration from someone or something: with credit being paid to beloved former teachers or batty great aunts for giving them the strength to succeed, but there cant be that many blokes who have been empowered by Elton John
continuation: . Granted , he may be one of the great entertainers of our times but a 60 something knight of the kingdom who has successfully defeated monsters and has been known for diva - ish behaviour of the very highest order is not someone I would ordinarily listen to for life lessons .So I was amazed to find myself muttering  good on you Elt  when I heard his views on parenting and how he expects to make his two sons work for their pocket cash . This from a man famed for his flamboyance and excesses but what he said , that when his boys are old enough they will work in the house and garden for their spends , made perfect sense .Despite his millions he believes his children to learn the true worth of money , a sentiment nearly every parent I understand publicly shares but often fails to honour . input: NEW YORK  One recent spring morning in the Utah desert, Jerry Foote received an ecstatic e-mail that gravitational forces were causing two stars to orbit each other, with one star swallowing matter from its companion. Rudolf Novak received the same message
continuation: sitting in Brno , a town in the Czech Republic . Joe Patterson , the sender of the e - mails and an astronomy professor at Columbia University , sought to know more about the star system , so he turned to stargazers like Foote and Novak , members of the Center for Backyard Astrophysics ( CBA ) .There is no " center " though . CBA is a collection of about 50 enthusiastic participants scattered across four continents .These amateur astronomers  or " CBAers " as they call themselves  study unpredictable binary stars , things no fixed observatory can do as efficiently . They do it on their own time and without paying .Night by night , for almost two decades , Patterson ' s group has been demonstrating the power of crowdsourcing , long before the word became a meme . CBA hints at the ways in which the public is taking scientific research away from laboratories .And in an era of tighter research budgets , there ' s an appeal to offering a free hand

SCRIBA, N.Y. - The refueling outage at the Unit 2 reactor at Nine Mile Point nuclear station provides a rare opportunity to go inside the plant while the reactor vessel is opened up.
Photographers from Syracuse.com took advantage
continuation: of that opportunity previous week . Their photos and video of the refueling floor , the engine building and other areas give an inside view of the plant that most people saw only from the outside .Some 1 , 500 additional jobs have been at the plant since April 11 , when owners took it offline for a refueling that is conducted every two years . During the outage , about one - fifth of the uranium fuel inside the reactor vessel is replaced and moved to the spent fuel pool .Plant manager Exelon Corp . also conducts maintenance work during the outage that cannot be performed while the plant is running . Among other tasks , workers have been working to finish up construction of a new hardened vent system that would eliminate hydrogen from the reactor building in the event of a major accident .Federal regulators allow the vents to be built in certain types of reactors , in reaction to the hydrogen fires that occurred during the 2011 Fukushima nuclear accident in Japan . The gritty streets of this 4-by-12-block sliver of a town in densely populated and urbanized northern Hudson County might be the last place to expect to find a largely volunteer fire department.
Such departments are usually associated with small-
continuation: town America , where volunteers rally at the fire station for camaraderie and cards , or rush from work at the blare of a siren . But matters have been different at the Guttenberg Fire Department .The volunteers still gather for a card game at the firehouse , but when there is an emergency they are called by beeper , not by siren . When the call arrives , it finds some of them at jobs a commuter ' s distance away .Last week the world around them altered , when the town councils in four surrounding cities voted to consolidate their all - pay blaze departments to save cash . And the new world of fire department regionalization is leaving Yves Saad , George Grennan , Eddie Huebsch and some of the other guys at the Guttenberg firehouse looking a little left out .The Jan . 1 start of regionalization will ending the Guttenberg department ' s mutual - aid agreements with some of the former single departments , but if it

MANIC STREET PREACHERS, returned to their punk roots tonight (March 8) at CARDIFF COAL EXCHANGE, with a violent hometown show.
The band performed their first UK date since their New Years Eve
continuation: show in 1999 at the nearby Millennium Stadium at the 600 - capacity Coal Exchange . The band saw the opportunity to totally destroy all their equipment , following an hour - long set which was broadcast live on BBC Radio 1 .The band completed their performance with an anthemic rendition of  A Design For Life  , at the end of which singer James Dean Bradfield took his prized white Les Paul Gibson guitar and smashed it into two pieces against the stage , before running off . Bassist Nicky Wire followed , smashing his bass , before stepping over to the amplifiers and shoving them over , and doing the same to the drumkit .Wire then stood on the drum riser , surveying the destruction in front of him . He gave a grin , waved to the audience , and left the stage .This followed a setting which displayed the Manics  ambition to return to their stripped - down , punk sound . Tennessee's state-run Achievement School District, which takes over low-performing schools and either runs them directly or hands them over to charter organizations, has run into partisan political trouble.
Several Democratic state lawmakers say they will propose bills this upcoming legislative
continuation: session to either shut down the turnaround district , which largely is based in Memphis , or severely restrict its authority to take over institutions . Citing a recent Vanderbilt University review , the lawmakers say district - leading turnaround efforts in Chattanooga , Memphis , and Nashville have academically outpaced the state ' s and that until the state - run district can begin to show academic success , it shouldn ' t be allowed to take over more schools ." The ASD should take return to its initial goal and refocus on intense intervention at a small number of education , " state Rep . Brenda Gilmore , chairwoman of the Black Caucus of State Legislators says during a media conference . Democrats don ' t have much sway in the state ' s Republican - controlled legislature , and Republican Gov .Bill Haslam and his appointed schools commissioner Candice McQueen indicated recently that they still support the turnaround initiative , which was established under the state ' s waiver from provisions of the now - defunct No Child Left Behind Act . The dollars might be held in escrow until ongoing lawsuit between the federal government and hospitals  currently proceeding through several federal courts  is resolved .The bill is intended to shield the state from potential liability . Two-time National

The family of the limousine driver involved in a deadly crash in upstate New York says they believe he was unwittingly assigned an unsafe vehicle.
The family of Scott Lisinicchia released a statement through their lawyer Tuesday asking the public to not
continuation: jump to conclusions about the cause of the accident that killed 20 people Saturday . Investigators are trying to find out why the limousine went through a stop sign at the bottom of a T - intersection on a rural street in Schoharie , 25 kilometers south of Albany .A attorney for the limo company indicated the driver was unfamiliar with the roads . But the statement from the Lisinicchia family says they believe " that unbeknownst to him he was provided with a vehicle that was neither roadworthy nor safe for any of its passengers . "The family ' s statement coming just minutes after New York State Police officially released the identities and hometowns of all 20 people killed in the accident . Investigators intend to examine the mangled limo ' s information recorders and hydraulic equipment as well as the highway , which has a history as a danger place .They are also searching into the driver ' s record and qualifications and staging an autopsy to see if drugs or drinking were factors .

input:
What's behind the jolt that performers get from being onstage? The necessity, the difficulty, the possibility of connecting with the audience.
Sam Pressler knows that the connection is everything, and is a master at helping people, specifically those with military
continuation: backgrounds , making connections . His nonprofit organization , Armed Services Arts Partnership , supports veterans link with their communities through the arts .If the distance between performer and audience can look insurmountable , and the performer feels severely outnumbered , that loneliness is a fraction of what some soldiers feel when they rejoin their communities after duty . For a actor , it feels great to connect to an audience ; for veterans , the stakes are much higher .Pressler was a student at William & Mary a few years ago when study in one of his classes on government led him to consider struggles for veterans with mental health issues and the gap between service people and civilians . He started a writing school for veterans , saw the therapeutic value , and then connected with another student , Ryan Goss , to create Comedy Bootcamp .Pressler told it was the first program of its kind in the nation , helping veterans adjust to life after duty , including in conflict zones , and deal with fear , depression and post - traumatic stress .

Swirling dust devils on Mars have given NASA scientists both a scientific treat and a very welcome power boost.
On 10 March, the rover Spirit captured images of two dust devils in one day. It is the first time any have been seen on Mars
continuation: since first being discovered in a single picture from the Mars Pathfinder mission in 1997 . One of the two appears on two different images from the rover  s Navigation Camera , making it able to track its direction and speed .Furthermore , a separate dust devil has apparently washed the rover clean . The electricity production of the rover  s solar panels had been reduced by almost half because of a year  s worth of deposited dust .But on 9 March , the output fired up to 93 % of its initial level , giving it more power for future exploration . Images staring down at the rover  s deck show an almost pristine surface , with just a few short tails of dust , compared to the dingy surface seen just a day prior .The crew is still figuring out exactly when the power boost occurred , and whether it was a single event or not . Science team member Geoffrey Landis told New Scientist that the cleaning of the solar panels may have took place at night .But dust devils

Over half of Europeans think that Israel now presents the biggest threat to world peace according to a controversial poll requested by the European Commission.
According to the same survey, Europeans believe the United States contributes the most to world instability along with Afghanistan, Iran,
continuation: Iraq and North Korea . The specially commissioned survey which answered citizens 15 questions on " the reconstruction of Iraq , the conflict in the Middle East and World peace " , has caused controversy in Brussels .The European Commission is coming under fire for publishing the results of a number of questions - relating to Iraqi reconstruction - while failing to publish the results which revealed the extent of mistrust of Israel and the United States in Europe . A Commission spokesperson today ( 30 October ) denied that the decision to withhold some of the results until last Monday was politically motivated , stating that some of the results not yet published are still " unstable " .He did , however , add that a decision was making to publish a preview of the matters relating to the reconstruction of Iraq , to coincide with the Iraqi donors conference in Madrid , which taken held at the end of last week . input: If President Clinton wants to see how activist government can solve social problems with strong public support, he should take a few days to visit Canada. With Toronto's World Series victory, the nationwide referendum on constitutional reform (including the status of Quebec), and the
continuation: controversy over the North American Free Trade Agreement , Canada lately has been in the American news more than at any time in recent memory . But despite all this attention , there ' s a Canada few Americans know about - - a nation whose citizens are better off than their American counterparts in multiple ways : better cities , fewer unemployment , fewer homeless , greater child mortality , and healthier workplaces .Clinton has promised to introduce , during the first 100 hours , comprehensive medical care legislation . Thanks to the recent national debate over our nation ' s health healthcare crisis , many Americans now believe that Canada does a better job of supplying proper health healthcare for all its citizens at a adequate cost .The U . S . spends more on health expenditures - - 12 . 4 percent of its GNP and $ 2 , 566 per capita - - than any country in the world , but 37 million citizens are without insurance . Canada spends 9 percent of GNP and $ 1 , 795 per capita and provides coverage for all inhabitants , financed by a single - payer system

Today's Millennials could be tomorrow's very sweaty retirees thanks to temperatures and humidity levels that are rising so fast that, by the end of this century, simply going outside could be deadly.
The study's alarming findings put into sharp perspective not just what
continuation: rising global temperatures can mean to today ' s youth but also how the overlooked factor of rising moisture - - which makes already killer temperatures even deadlier - - will also come to make summertime gradually miserable and hazardous . The body ' s capacity to calm down in hot temperatures depends on the evaporation of sweat .That stays skin pressure below 95 degrees Fahrenheit ( 35 Celsius ) . Above that , core temperature rises past 98 . 6F .But if temperature is also high , sweat cannot evaporate , and core heat can increase until the person collapses from heat stroke .  If it ' s humid you can ' t sweat , and if you can ' t sweat you can ' t maintain core bodies temperature in the heat , and you die ,  said Dr Al Sommer , rector emeritus of the Bloomberg School of Public Health at Johns Hopkins University and author of a chapter on health effects in the new report .The largest heat - plus - humidity reading in the United States was in 1995 in Appleton , Wisconsin ,

Police recruits should try to answer every question on a screening exam.
2 What Are Some Disqualifications for Getting a Job With a Police Department?
For police recruits, the psychological evaluation process represents one of the last hurdles to getting hired. The
continuation: process can feel terrifying , since it takes filling out an extensive personality questionnaire , and addressing the results during an interview with a police psychologist . Instead of stressing out over the process , smart recruits concentrate on answering all the answers as honestly - - and completely - - as possible .This method pays bigger dividends than attempting to manipulate the answers , which only hurts your chances . Generally speaking , applicants who make a point of knowing the process fare better than those who don ' t .Though the results are confidential , don ' t treat screenings like a therapy session , nor assume a doctor / patient relationship with the examining psychologist , " Police Psychology " journal advises . Both steps are simply intended to assist cops departments assess your suitability for a certain opening .An negative result doesn ' t mean that you have a behavioral problem , or can ' t work for a different agency . In 1874, Karl Marx had an imaginary conversation with Mikhail Bakunin. Nowadays, they would just have had a Twitter spat, but back then
continuation: the son of Communism was compelled to spend an hour copying out bits of the anarchist philosopher ' s book into a notepad and then writing out his counter - ideas . Bakunin ' s book was itself asking questions about exactly what this ' regime of the proletariat ' Marx had proposed entailed ." Will the entire proletariat possibly stand at the head of the state ? " he asked rhetorically ." The Germans number around forty million . Will for example all forty million be member of the cabinet ? "" In a trade union , for example , does the whole association form its executive committee ? " It was a telling response .For Marx , the fact a trade union executive commission was composed of representatives of the same class ensured it would always represent their interests . The only power for Marx was economic .Once you made everyone economically equal , we were all equal in every way , even if some of us were on the executive committee . input: NOVOLUHANSKE, Ukraine (Reuters) - Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko thought he could rely for his re-election in part on the votes of soldiers who have spent years fighting pro-Russian separatists. But a visit to the frontline

continuation: a B . Siegel . continuation: spouse to Staff Sgt . Nickolas Noland , Noland has been called Fort Leonard Wood ' s " Foodie of the Fort " for March .Noland enjoys exotic culinary treats , but , as a busy mom , she also prides herself in making food the household loves . A . I do call myself a foodie .I not only love how food smells but I enjoy how it looks and how it tastes . I enjoy try new flavors from all over the world , by making it at home and enjoying new dishes at restaurants .I normally publish meals on my Instagram and Facebook page for my friends to see . I like the creativity with the senses that eating offers .Q . What is your specialty dish ?Why did you select it ? A . I have a few recipes that are my absolute favorite to make but I selected caribou sausage lasagna as my specialty .I selected this dish because I wanted to commemorate my Alaskan origins and my love of Italian food .

Thermal emission from erupting volcanoes on the Jupiter's moon Io. A logarithmic scale is used to classify volcanoes on the basis of thermal emission; the larger the spot, the larger the thermal emission.
A new map of
continuation: Jupiter ' s oddly active moon Io has exposed the location of the moon ' s several erupting volcanoes , raising as much questions about the enigmatic satellite as it answers . The map is the most systematic ever compiled of Io ' s dozens of active volcanoes , researchers thought .It additionally indicates a complex , multi - layer source for the lunar ' s massive stores of internal thermal energy , which may come as a surprise to some astronomers . " The interesting thing about the distribution of the heat flow is that it is not in keeping with the current preferred model of tidal heating of Io at fairly shallow depths , " co - editor Ashley Davies , of NASA ' s Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena , Calif . , said in a statement ." Instead , the main thermal emission occurs about 40 degrees eastward of its expected positions . " The warmth is also come from Io ' s depths along with its shallower reaches , researchers says ." Hourly workers aren't the only ones who have to track hours worked.
2 What if a Salaried Employee Works More Than 40 Hours?
Ask two workers if they prefer a salary or hourly wage, you will likely get two different answers
continuation: . Using the Fair Labor Standards Act exempt classification tests , salaried staff are exempt from overtime pay regulations , meaning they don  t get extra pay for working more than 40 hours in a week .Hourly , non - exempt workers , on the other hand , receive one and a half times their hourly rate for working more than 40 hours per month . Nevertheless , the exempt employee who prefers a pay wage sees the benefits and obligations involved with being on a quarterly or annual pay .Salaried employees who are indeed excluded from the Fair Labor Standards Act have the benefit of calculating near - exact amounts of yearly or quarterly wages . Their salaries rarely fluctuate due to overtime pay , or docking for an hour or two off from work .This helps with averaging monthly or weekly pay due and it also salaried staff from varying on wages from planned overtime . input: The dominant position that Microsoft software occupies on the desktop has long been a major source of competitive advantage to Microsoft. Not only does it ensure that users of Microsoft software are familiar with the look and feel of the Microsoft interface but it also has provided a launch

Adobe has an unique strategy to exploit its digital document administration functionality with an Intelligent Document Architecture .It is leveraging client capability to create universally readable and secure files into a complete range of document - centric functionality for Document Generation , Document Collaboration , Document Control and Security , and Process Management . input: TUCSON, Ariz. (AP) Arizona was shaky with the ball early, had trouble getting shots to fall from the perimeter. With a roster full of new players and old players in new roles, it was kind of expected.
continuation: Once the Wildcats got rolling , Houston Baptist actually had no opportunity . Brandon Randolph scored 25 points , Brandon Williams added 13 and Arizona opened a transitional season with a 90 - 60 win over Houston Baptist Wednesday day ." We didn ' t have a tremendous deal of confidence , which that ' s kind of who we are right now , " Arizona coach Sean Miller stated of the first half . " We ' re a bunch of men who haven ' t played together and our hope is as we continue to work in practice , those experiences will assist us improve . "The new - look Wildcats had a slew of turnovers in the first half as they fought first - game jitters , but shook those out at halftime to quickly take a nine - point lead into a rout with 57 fourth - half points . The perimeter shots weren ' t dropping most of the night - 6 for 22 from the 3 - point line - but the defense was good all night , allowing Arizona to stretch its nonconference home wins streak to 48 straight games .

continuation: city , Paterson . It was a tough assignment .First , the emphasis on politics and city administration as the reason for failure and public corruption  the usual approach in addressing this situation  is completely misplaced . We have to see Paterson  s plight from the opposite prism .Government , politics and the people who participate in public life simply reflect the aspirations , aspirations , hopes , fears and the political culture of the people of that place . While there are areas of Paterson that continue vibrant , such as Main Street in South Paterson , there are too several parts of the cities that mimic a battlefield with boarded - up homes and storefronts , roads in disrepair , violent crime and poor public schools that have coming to reflect and symbolize the emptiness feel in the hearts and souls of too many Patersonians .Simply putting , failure breeds failure while success breeds success . input: CANBERRA, Australia -- A four-year search of the depths of the Indian Ocean has failed to find Malaysia Airlines Flight 370. But the unprecedented sonar hunt for the missing airliner might be close to solving 19th century mysteries - the locations of
continuation: two sailing vessels that vanished with cargos of coal . Maritime historians on Thursday published a brief list of the possible identities of two shipwrecks discovered during the first 710 , 000 - square kilometer ( 274 , 000 - square mile ) three - month search for the Boeing 777 that was lost in 2014 with 238 men aboard .The wrecks , found in 2015 , are 36 km ( 22 kilometers ) apart and 2 , 300 kilometers ( 1 , 440 mi ) southwest of Australia in debris areas scattered with coal more than 3 . 7 kilometers ( 2 . 3 miles ) below the ocean ' s surface . The E-notation means that you should multiply the constant by 10 raised to the power following the "E". Hence, 2.0E6 is two million, while 3.333E-1 is approximately one third.
Here 2.0
continuation: D - 1 is a double precision one - fifth , while 1D99 is a one followed by 99 zeros . The first number denotes the real part and the second the imaginary part .Note that the dots enclosing the letters are required . All these operators are calculated left - to - right , except the exponentiation operator * * , which has right - to - left precedence .If you want to alter the default evaluation order , you can using parentheses . The above operators are all binary operators .there is also the unary operator - for negation , which gets precedence over the others . Hence an expression like - x + y implies what you might expect .Extreme caution must be taken when using the division operator , which has a quite different meaning for integers and reals . If the operands are both integers , an integer division is conducted , otherwise a real arithmetic division is conducted .For instance , 3 / 2 equals 1 , while 3 . / 2 . equals 1 . 5

The Senate is in a standoff regarding bills that would send relief funding to Puerto Rico, which is still recovering from Hurricane Maria.
On Monday (April 1), a measure was defeated in the Senate to provide disaster relief for Puerto Rico. Democrats voted against
continuation: the bill , which they believe reflects the White House  s continued disregard for the island . Left wing party Syriza was elected on an anti-austerity programme and now it is implementing the worst austerity measures yet.

continuation: relying on the votes of the right wing and centre parties that backed a yes to austerity in earlier week  s referendum . Before there was television, there was radio.
TV took radios shows, sponsors and many of its stars. It took the concept of networks, the 30-minute time slot and theme songs.
It duplicated most of radio
continuation: s programming ideas , such as aired soap operas during the day and providing  prime time  programs at night . Radio wrote the book on delivering home entertainment .Television simply revised it  with pictures . The power of television  the ability to imprint images on viewers  minds  transforms long careers into TV roles that might have only lasted several years .It  s understandable , of course , when the public can put a name to a face they saw each week . Yet it  s possible to overlook a lifetime of work in the blink of a TV eye .The following 10 TV stars all had illustrious careers on radio , not only playing a broad variety of roles but created some of the most captivating characters in media history , many soon embraced for the home screen . These web pages can make or break a corporation ' s reputation because they give links to one another and allow people to comment on postings .In reality the medium has become so important that Bill Gates has even opened his own website ( at www . microsoft . com / billgates ) , which is rumoured to be on the verge of modernisation - containing regular updates instead than just transcripts of lectures . input: HOUSTON (CN)  A Mexican woman being held in a Houston immigration jail despite agreeing to return to the country she left with her parents as an infant won a small victory Monday when a federal judge said she should get a bond hearing to lobby for
continuation: her release . Jessica Farfan Angel , 34 , is a legal permanent resident and single mom of a 16 - year - old son .Her family says she altered her life after pleading guilty to misdemeanor attempted possession of less than one gram of cocaine in 2006 and serving a week in Harris County Jail in Houston .  She  s a tremendous mom .She is mother and dad . That  s the only someone I have .She would go to work for me to getting me this and that , work Saturdays for me , do anything for me ,  her son Junior Martinez said Monday afternoon after her hearing at the federal courthouse in downtown Houston . Martinez added his wife , who works in the medical field in billing and as a surgery associate , had grabbed up a second job and was looking forward to starting it the next day when immigration agents detained her at Bush Intercontinental Airport on a Sunday in February , while mother and son were leaving from a brief trip to Mexico .

input: The five-member team of Indian MPs, which interacted with a cross section of political leaders, civil society personalities and government functionaries both in Colombo and Jaffna over the last four days, returned to India on Friday, fully sensitised to

All eyes will be on Telkom and its subsidiary Vodacom tomorrow as they release their annual financial results.

continuation: other things , Telkom  s recent wave of resignations , notably that of chief executive Papi Molotsane . The departures come as Telkom badly needs options to diversify its business to reduce fell fixed - line sales .This month the fixed - line operator lost its third top executive , Steven Hayward , the managing executive of retail marketing . Two months ago Wally Beelders , the head of selling and marketing , and Thami Msimang , the head technical executive , left Telkom to join Vodacom  s new internet service provider group .Their resignations were followed by Molotsanes in April.There has been no explanation from the company about his sudden departure.Reuben September , Telkom  s chief operating executive , was elected acting chief executive and subsequently appointed to the company  s board . ATTOCK  The Attock Chamber of Commerce and Industry (ACCI) on Sunday said extensive sensitive lists being maintained by different countries is hindering progress and growth of trade within Saarc region.
The last two decades have witnessed a number of attempts
continuation: by South Asian governments to promote intra - regional trade through several agreements but with minimal success , it said . Main explanation behind reduced intra - Saarc commerce which is hovering around four per cent of the total trade is huge negative trade registers kept by the member countries which has left all efforts to stimulate commerce mostly failed , said Tariq Mehmood , President ACCI .Speaking to commercial community , he said that all Saarc nations are providing protection to sectors regarded unfit for competition like infant manufacturing , low - scale producers , and farm products . All states of the grouping must realise that trade agreements might be beneficial only when negative lists are established on merit and for a certain period to be phased out eventually , he added .Tariq Mehmood said that all Saarc countries should be made to review the sensitive lists for reduction every two years under the tariff liberalisation programme of SAFTA . The West might have been won with the Winchester. But Japan was ruled with the katana. It's not simply what the gun is to Americans, the sword is to the Japanese. It's much more, and then some.
As master sword
continuation: maker Korehira Watanabe stated in the above Esty documentary , the katana can express the soul and the beauty of the Japanese people . Watanabe is one of only thirty master sword masters remaining in the nation .The practice fell by the wayside over through the ages . There are many motives for this : the Meiji government ' s decision to outlaw the samurai from bearing katana in the 19th century , only allowing the army and the authorities to carry them .Or merely that , over time , the formulas for make certain types of blades were lost to the sands of time . Japan is a region rich in tradition .Yet , many of those practices seem fuddy - duddy and only passively interesting to modern Japanese . Many young Japanese women can ' t even tie kimonos themselves , and must go to a kimono fitter and pay someone to help them throw it on .Swords are very much a component of popular folklore in Japan , appearing in films ,

eBay is ending its payment processing relationship with PayPal, but let's dive deeper.
eBay (NASDAQ:EBAY) unveiled a nice little surprise for investors with its fourth-quarter earnings report. Well, nice for eBay; not
continuation: so lovely for PayPal Holdings ( NASDAQ : PYPL ) . The online marketplace will start taking control of payments on its platform instead of using PayPal to process transactions .This is a considerable shift for both firms , as the two have had a lengthy partnership , and eBay presents a substantial portion of payment volume and revenue for PayPal . The payments service was a division of eBay until 2015 , when it was spun off .There are several important things for investors to comprehend about the future relationship between eBay and PayPal . It ' s not as if shoppers visiting eBay today are suddenly unable to use PayPal to check out .The present operating agreement with PayPal allows almost all of eBay to give practically all of its transaction processing to PayPal . For the next year and a half , eBay will be possible to process 5 % of payments in two countries of its choice .That jumps up to 10 % in mid - 2019 , and it lasts until the end of the operating agreement in July 2020 . Ontarios doctors are talking about a job action in the new year, escalating their argument with the province over how and how much they should be paid.
So far its just a threat  the threat of a threat,
continuation: in fact . But it  s a sign that a year of angry rhetoric between the OMA and the government is get the two sides no closer to a settlement .A quick sketch of the situation : Ontario spends about $ 11 billion a year on physicians , a third of its health budget , which is the province  s single greatest budget area . The details of that expenditure are a rat  s - maze but much of the money goes out in fees - for - service , where one procedure , one appointment , one task brought a doctor a number of money outlined in a huge Physician Services Agreement that  s like a labour deal for the OMA  s 42 , 000 members .The last agreement ended in 2014 and efforts to bargain a new one have failed . The government seeks a tough cap on total physician billings and to  modernize  ( that is , cut ) what it pays for some treatments that software has made a lot easy .

input: Interior designer Abbe Fenimore knew that adding a kitchen island was one of the most important decisions shed make in remodeling her 1940s-era home in Dallas. A well-designed kitchen island can offer storage space, a work
continuation: surface , comfortable seating  even a cooktop or spare sink . But like so several elements of kitchen design , it needs to be planned with extra care .An item this big and central isn  t something you  ll want to replace within just a few years . So Fenimore and her husband constructed a cardboard island in their kitchen with precise dimensions to live with it before committing .They tinkered with the details on its size and location . They debated which features were required , and which were too much of a splurge or taken up too much space .In the end , that island  has become the literal hub in our home for socializing ,  Fenimore argues . input: Ethiopia says despite its trade relations with Somalias breakaway enclave of Somaliland, it does not support the sovereignty of the self-declared republic. Ethiopian foreign minister Seyoum Mesfin says Somaliland deserves to be
continuation: rewarded for building peace out of anarchy , but no person should confuse Ethiopia  s trade ties there as recognition of its bid for nationhood . Last year , the Ethiopian government sent a formal delegation to the former British Somaliland and negotiated agreements to stimulate cross - border commerce and use the Berbera harbour .Many viewed the deals as a tacit recognition of Somaliland  s much - rebuffed bid for autonomy . Matt Bryden is the director of the Horn of Africa Project of the International Crisis Group .He tells English to Africa correspondent Ashenafi Abedje that tonight  s statement by the foreign minister doesn  t alter the Ethiopian position on Somaliland . Attractive display of merchandise, like these antique bottles, attracts customers to your booth.
Every clothing store owner wants to see heavy traffic on the sales floor, but sales associates often need motivation to persuade the shopper to turn "I'm just looking
continuation: " into " I ' ll taking three . " The shop manager can motivate her staff by displaying apparel - inspired bulletin boards designed to keep sales personnel aware about sales stats , impending clothing trends or to reward employee achievement .An animated bulletin board on which your sales agents can communicate with a paper doll is an appropriate topic for increasing goals in a women ' s clothing store . Cut a large paper doll from construction paper and adorn it with a small dark skirt cut from a template or doll pattern .It must not be elaborate ; use one article of fabric and cut the form of its sleeves , neckline , bodice and a full - length gown . Attach the toy to a horizontally oriented bulletin board with glue or tape , then put grid lines and benchmarks or selling objective marks perpendicular to the toy .As the team attains certain benchmarks , cut a half inch of fabric off the hem of the dress to match the tick marks on the correlating grid . Friday, the Fourth National Climate Assessment was released. Its a sobering look at the economic and physical effects of climate change in the United States, and where those changes are leading.
At 1,656 pages, the report is massive
continuation: . Much of the news reporting of the document focused on the fact that its results are diametrically hostile to the warming values espoused by the American president , and the fact the document was released on the Friday after American Thanksgiving , a day where news articles go to die .One of the most exciting parts of the report for Atlantic Canadians may well be the part that  s closest to us : the future of the Northeastern corner of the United States , a region that has much in common with ours . Keep in mind that  s less than 20 years away  and it  s not just temperatures changing .The review warns of greater coastal erosion , greater than experienced tides , and much more serious hurricane surges . The economic effects are already substantial and will expand .Warmer winters , with significantly more peak rainfall , will add a host of changes , from potential damage to the forest business from improved numbers of pests , to problems for fruit plants that might blossom soon and

Mr Clegg had done a Greta Garbo... I vant to be alone!
Anyone seen our Cleggy? Lib Dem MPs sat there looking faintly sorrowful, like children who had just booted their football over the garden fence. This was
continuation: understandable . Nick Clegg , with his trademark fortitude , had failed to show for David Cameron  s statement about the great Brussels veto .Vroop vroop!Man down!Missing in action ! Quick , someone go on the blower to Prince William and ask him to hop into his helicopter for a rescue mission .Mr Clegg had done a Greta Garbo . He had retreated to a quiet room , to admire his reflection ( and later grant an interview to Sky News ) . I vant to be alone !  the Garbo ( mis ) quotation goes . At the rate his opinion poll ratings are going , the Cleggster could later attain that ambition .Actually , he probably take the reasonable option . Had he been in his normal place beside the PM he would only have been mocked even more and Mr Cameron might have been in an embarrassing place .Let us change the habit of a lifetime and trying to be fair to Mr Clegg .

input: Infertility is one of the most difficult problems a couple can go through, and many people find discussing the issue with friends and family only makes things worse. A new study found that there are differences in the way men and women share information about their fertility
continuation: problems with those around them , and there are ways to approach the subject that can make things considerably better for the couple . Researchers from the University of Iowa and Penn State University interviewed with 50 heterosexual married couples who ' ve been struggling with infertility for eight weeks to five months , according to EurekAlert .They found that couples often adapt how many data they share with their loved people based on whether the man or the woman feels more stigmatized by their reproductive issues . When the woman is more worried about how people will react to her infertility , both partners share more with friends and family .However , when the man is more worried about how he ' ll be viewed , both partners stay their problems quiet . " It aligns with the idea that partnerships do more work to keep the husband ' s public persona . . . For female , it could be a reaction to our pronatalist tradition .There ' s an expectation that women need kids , and sometimes those who are willingly childless are labeled as selfish or too career -

Ford is accelerating the automotive design process with the Microsoft HoloLens virtual reality headset after a year-long pilot program.
Coming off a year-long pilot program, Microsoft and Ford have taken the wraps off a collaboration between the two companies that will help
continuation: the automaker ' s designers gotten their creations on the highway faster by using HoloLens . Microsoft ' s HoloLens is a standalone headset with augmented - reality capabilities that works independently of a PC , unlike most of today ' s virtual reality ( VR ) headsets that require a physical link to a computing machine .Although it can fuel some new and novel entertainment opportunities , Microsoft has been focused mainly on pulling HoloLens into the hands of enterprise consumers who can afford its $ 3 , 000 price tag . Some of those subscribers now include the craftsmen and female at Ford ." With HoloLens , Ford designers are blending 3D holograms digitally with both clay models and physical manufacturing automobiles , " wrote Lorraine Bardeen , general manager of Microsoft HoloLens and Windows Experiences , in a Sept . 20 blog post . " This enables designers to study considerably more easily without having to physically construct every design model in clay , which can limit creativity with shorter steps .This new technology lets them to create and iterate more freely

 Friedan is very interested in female
continuation: education . Do any of your teachers stand out as being particularly good or bad ?How ?  Do you felt better educated than your mother ?Your father ? Your siblings ? When you were younger did you say , " When I grow up I want to be  ? " Did you become that ? What is your picture of yourself ? It is easier to live through someone else than to become full yourself .That line remains useful to those of us who know women  parents ? friends ?ourselves ?  who operate vicariously through their children rather than grow their own identity .Friedan helps ladies to facing their problems . Over the last 50 years we have get good at identifying our problems , perhaps even face them , but they haven ' t gone away .I ' m not talking about the discrepancies that exist in the workplace or politics , I ' m talking ( as Friedan did ) about the internal issues of identity . Former accident investigator Steven Wallace speaks to circumstances if flight path was pre-programmed into the computer.
The pilot and first officer of the missing plane, both of them Malaysian, have come under

input: Getting people to interact with others and upload content to a community-driven site enough may sound easy, but engagement doesnt happen automatically. It takes time and work, and much of the right formula is deduced through trial and error.
continuation: Here are 10 tips for expanding user participation that work for news community internet sites , but can apply to all types of internet user - engagement sites . This seems like a no - brainer .If it is not clear that someone can do everything on a site , they won  t . Create numerous entry points and ways to access the online community and use actionable language to turn observers into contributors . I  ve gotten feedback from people who didn  t quite understand how to participate and if it appears to be a problem for many , we reevaluate how we  re displaying the message . input: Part Two: Last week I wrote about "Employee A," a prickly and counterproductive woman who was terminated by a female client of mine who had just purchased the company. Today we look at another employee that helped to create incivility in the

Employee B : Worked in the warehouse .He might come to the manager almost regularly with reasons why he could not do certain tasks . When he was challenged on his complaint , he called her a " liar . "Feeling like Donald Trump , with no option , the new boss sacked him on the spot , just a few months after she bought the company . continuation: in the U . S . , accounting for over 480 , 000 deaths per year .  The CDC just reported that smoking numbers among U . S . individuals have fallen to the lowest level ever recorded  only 14 percent , fewer than a third the rate just 70 weeks ago . While this decline is surprising , it also points to a puzzle : How did smoking rates ever get so high in the first place ?November is Lung Cancer Awareness Month , which offers a timely opportunity to review the history of tobacco smoking and its promotion . Smoking has numerous appeals .First , tobacco naturally contains nicotine , an insecticide , which increases alertness , speeds reaction times , and stimulates the release of neurotransmitters such as dopamine , which are associated with enjoyment . Second , tobacco might provide opportunities to flout authority and fit in with peer groups .Third , once someone has begun smoking , efforts to halt might precipitate withdrawal symptoms such as headaches , nausea , anxiety and weight gain . input: Alastair Cook has been granted more time to decide his future as Test captain, with England having privately advised that Fridays meeting with the director of cricket, Andrew Strauss, will not be followed by a definitive announcement on the subject.
continuation: Cook has been mulling over whether to remain in the role since returning home from the 4 - 0 series victory to India before Christmas and there has been a mounting expectation in recent weeks that he is prepared to call time on his four - week reign and turn over the leadership to his deputy - captain , Joe Root . But while England have confirmed that he and Strauss will get together for the first time since the India loss as part of their overall review of the tour , they have also stressed that neither party is going into the negotiations looking to resolution the issue of the captaincy immediately given the last Test match is not until 6 July , against South Africa at Lord  s .By looking to pull the heat out of the situation in this way  and kept the emphasis on the limited - overs matches with India that start in Pune on Sunday with the first of three one - day internationals  there is definitely no will on the part of Strauss to sack his former opening partner promptly .

input: That it's such a hidden statistic, however, is an embarrassing reflection of our collective ignorance. Hundreds more people died by suicide in Oregon in 2017 than by traffic crashes, firearms or drug overdose. The suicide rate in Oregon is well above the national average
continuation: , as it has been for the previous three decades . Yet this undeniable public medical issue has lacked the public attention and sustained outcry that it desperately needs .Some of that stems from the stigma that persists around mental illness and suicide , shutting off conversation or even acknowledgment that a suicide has occurred . Some may stem from the fear of encouraging " copycat " behavior .Regardless of the motivation , however , our families , schools , communities and media organizations have too often choice the easy way out by simply keeping quiet . Meanwhile , the suicide rate in Oregon and the United States has continued to climb .Clearly , silence hasn ' t worked . This week , news organizations around the state are collaborating to bring attention to the issue of death , report on populations at highest risk and share resources on how to reduce it .While the " Breaking the Silence " initiative won ' t necessarily provide answers , it aims to start a statewide attempt to overcome it . Using responsible reporting practices that examine , not sensationalize , suicide , these stories can

input: As part of an effort to give applications more control over the infrastructure used to host them in the cloud, Riverbed Technology today at the Interop 2013 conference unveiled the Stingray Services Controller, a next-generation instance of the virtual application delivery controller (
continuation: ADC ) that Riverbed achieved when it purchased Zeus Technology in 2011 . According to Kavitha Mariappan , director of product sales for the Riverbed Stingray business unit , a virtual instance of an ADC will provide IT organizations to deploy application delivery controller as a service ( ADCaaS ) in way that giving each cloud application its own ADC , rather than having to exchange a single physical ADC across multiple clients .That solution , says Mariappan , will able IT organizations to automate the implementation of ADCs , which ultimately will result in better deployment of applications in either public or private cloud computing scenarios . To address the different characteristics of several applications , the Stingray Services Controller can be configured in what Riverbed calls  micro instances  of the Stingray Traffic Manager , which can dynamically scale in size to support applications as they grow .In addition , Mariappan says this methodology allows ADC technology to be more granularly applied to hyper - elastic cloud

input: "Two Novelties in Russian Courts: Defense Lawyers and Jury Trials" (front page, May 11) reports that there are 50,000 lawyers in Russia, about half of them defense lawyers, many of them graduated from military or K.G.
continuation: B . institutes , and that there were 20 twice more attorneys in Russia in 1913 than today . In 1990 , there were some 250 , 000 to 300 , 000 practicing lawyers in the Soviet Union ; approximately 150 , 000 to 200 , 000 of them in Russia ; some three to four times your figure .Only one in 10 of the Soviet Union ' s attorneys were defense lawyers in 1990 , not half - - some 26 , 000 in the Soviet Union and about 16 , 000 in Russia .
