Texas has become the first state in the nation to require law enforcement to obtain a warrant to read people's email, and privacy advocates are hoping the move will help quicken the passage of a similar proposal in Congress.

continuation: the privacy bill last week . The idea was introduced in the Legislature by 29 - month - old Republican Rep . Jonathan Stickland , a conservative with Tea Party backing .Liberals also endorsed the bill . While the Lone Star state is the first , it is unlikely to be the last to pass such a law .The California Legislature is proposing a legislation barring warrantless email tracking and snooping on messages and profile details stored on social networking networks like Facebook and Twitter . Privacy advocates are hoping that states passing such laws will pressure Congress to amend the Electronic Communications Privacy Act , which requires a warrant only for unopened email .Opened texts , as well as text left unopened for more than 180 days , do not require government law enforcement to getting a warrant . " The big impact is a signal to Congress that you can pass this kinds of legislation and the world will not drop apart and the heavens will not drop , " added Hanni Fakhoury , staff prosecutor for the Electronic Frontier Foundation .

continuation: belts . The last time we had a reduction of this type was in 1992 ,  CHP Commissioner Mike Brown stated of the decline in deaths , when changes in seat belt and helmet legislation are considered to have forced safer habits . Statewide , 3 , 907 persons died in traffic crashes in 2006 compared with 4 , 304 in 2005 .There were 547 crashes on Highway 17 last year , down from 689 in 2005 and down from 896 in 1998 , the year before the CHP , Caltrans and transportation authorities in Santa Cruz and Santa Clara counties undertook on a safety effort to rein in a rising collision rate . input: The return of dolphins to Long Island Sound this summer is tangible evidence that efforts to restore the Sound are making progress. Recent reports about hypoxia -- deadly low levels of oxygen -- and beach closings tell us how far we still have to go.
continuation: Despite strides toward cleaner waters , we must do more to ensure the health of this estuary that sustains the economic vitality , ecological diversity and quality of life in our communities and the region . The Connecticut Department of Environmental Protection newly released estimates indicating that the " dead zone " in western Long Island Sound - - an area where oxygen levels are too low to support life - - increased in width to 180 square miles in the winter of 2008 , up from 162 square miles in 2007 .A primary cause of hypoxia is excess nitrogen released by wastewater treatment plants , residential septic facilities and air pollution . Nutrient and bacteria - loaded animal trash and fertilizers that wash during storms from lawns and other surfaces into tributaries and hurricane drains draining into the Sound contribute to the issue .Runoff carries a harmful mixture of bacteria , pesticides , and other biological and chemical pathogens into our coastal seas . People are the ultimate source of those toxicants .Statistics on Connecticut shore closings additionally give a troubling tale . Fair

Hang headboards on sturdy cleats.
Measure the distance from the floor up the wall to the desired terminating point at the top of the headboard. Subtract 6 inches and make a mark. Use a level to draw an 18-
continuation: inch line on the wall at the mark . Center the line horizontally in the area where the headboard will go .Run a stud finder along the line and locate two studs . If you can ' t find two studs , extend the line to the left or right until you can locate two studs .Screw one of the cleats to the wall studs , flush with the line with two 2 - inch screws and a drill / driver . The cleat has pilot holes spaced16 inches apart for this function .There are two steel cleats per set . They both have angled lips .The angle on the cleat should be facing up . Measure 6 inches down from the top of the headboard and leave a mark on the back .Use a level to pull an 18 - inch line located on the back of the headboard . Screw the cleat flush to the line utilizing two 3 / 4 - inch screws .The angled lip should be facing down .

There's something important that chronically indecisive people need to understand: They're not actually interested in making a decision. Since this statement flies brazenly in the face of common sense, let me restate it differently.
Indeed, as these individuals anguish
continuation: intensely over the pros and cons of a given option , they believe they want to be crucial . But they ' re fooling themselves .Behind their apparent sincerity , they ' re cozying up to an old unresolved negative emotion ( internal passivity ) which includes felt weak , helpless , and lacking in the sense of their own authority . This old joking satirizes the emotional predicament : " Once I make up my mind , I ' m full of indecision . "Through this psychological weakness , indecisiveness haunts a substantial proportion of people . When we finally do make up our mind - - after agonizing and procrastinating long enough - - we ' re likely to start being indecisive over some other matter .The pain and self - defeating consequences of our indecisiveness are the prices we paying to cover up an inner dispute . input: This basic galette recipe can be tailored to fit whatever fruit you have on hand. The key is to scale the amount of sugar and cornstarch. Generally speaking, tart stone fruits (apricots, peaches, nectarines, pl
continuation: ums , bitter cherries ) need a greater portion of both sugar and cornstarch while figs , grapes , berries and Bing cherries tend to require less . If you  re uncertain , addition the sugar gradually , smelling as you go .Spreading a thin layer of jam over the rolled out dough before add the filling bumps up the fruit flavor . You can match the jam flavors to your fruit or blend it up for a contrast .And if you don  t want to addition lemon zest to the fruit , consider the seeds from a vanilla bean , ground spices , or some minced candied ginger instead . You can make the dough up to three weeks ahead , but this galette is at its best served the same day it was cooked .Featured in : The Galette Forgives You . input:
The extent of GOP efforts to prevent black people and Latinos from voting is jaw-dropping. And this Nov. 8, minority voters need to document it so America can see.
Donald Trumps offensive statements and the chaos theyve
continuation: brought to the Republican Party have been the headline - grabbing events of this election . But the biggest story , which is regularly overlooked , is the systematic disenfranchisement of millions of American voters , mainly African Americans and Latinos .Since sections of the Voting Rights Act were struck down by the Supreme Court in 2013 in Shelby County v . Holder , 14 states have adopted new voting restrictions in this election , and this reflects only a sliver of the seismic situation faced our democracy in this presidential contest . Some estimates anticipate that approximately 1 . 3 million voters in vital swing countries could be disenfranchised because of these new voting restrictions .Additionally , more than 6 million Americans will be barred from votes due to felony convictions , and 2 . 2 million of those are African American . This amounts to 1 out of every 13 African Americans of vote age being prevented from the ballot box .And in Florida , 23 percent of African Americans are prevented from votes due to felony convictions even after they  ve done their time .

input:
It took just 80 years for the Roman Empire to fall apart as a political unit.
When Theodosius the Great died in 395, he bequeathed to his two feckless sonsHonorius, a 10-year-
continuation: old who would reign from the west , and Arcadius , a 17 - year - old placed in the east  a functioning if creaking and ponderous kingdom that ran from the North Sea to the Arabian Desert . While Britain and the northern part of Gaul ( France and Belgium ) had been slipping from Rome  s grasp for a while , for the most part its borders were safe , and there hadn  t been a major barbarian incursion in generations .The economy was booming , entering a peak of efficiency and integration . There were reasons to be worried , though .The year before Theodosius  s death had saw a catastrophic civil war that ruined the professional military of the western half of the empire , and there were no favorable precedents for rule by a minor in Roman history . The late incarnation of the Roman Empire , an increasingly centralized and authoritarian state , depended on having a competent adult running things from the center who might form decisive decisions and dispense patronage .

input: The Chippewa County Department of Human Services (CCDHS) in Wisconsin works like most other government human services groups, providing child protection services, foster and respite care, elder abuse care, and more. However, they recently launched an

continuation: s capable of some small level of humility . continuation: It occurred when the MTA blasted a section of stone 40 feet below the street to build an escalator shaft for the new subway line on Tuesday . The explosion smashed doors and sent Upper East Siders scurrying for cover as boulders pelted the street ." The force of yesterday ' s controlled bombing was focused in one region that was not anticipated , " added MTA spokesman Adam Lisberg . " The force of that blast struck the underside of an inch - thick steel plate that enclosed the site at street level .It was never built to handle that much force . It was not anchored into anything , it was just sat there .So it blew upward and permitted rock and dust to scatter . " Lisberg vowed that no additional work would taking place until the MTA got to the bottom of the incident ." Security always comes down to securing applications.
The whole point of firewalls is to hide internally deployed network applicationsassumed to have exploitable vulnerabilities somewherefrom the outside world.
The main weakness of firewalls is that they are
continuation: based on a one - application / one - IP - port model , something that worked in the pre - Web years but is completely insufficient now . These days , most application information flowing through firewalls and over network backbones is on HTTP ports 80 or 443 .Thats why the main burden of security now falls on those who maintain Web sites and on those who write Web - faced applications or Web services . Web services are extremely vulnerable , and since several of them are both one - of - a - kind and internal , there is no vendor testing or patching process to assist with the security burden .Writing secure applications is a matter of knowing the problems and writing defensively to anticipate the kinds of assaults that are possible online . input: ORLANDO -- Leading Republican presidential candidate Ben Carson believes that federal and state official overreacted in trying to save Terri Schiavo, a Florida woman who died in 2005 as her husband and family battled over whether to keep her alive despite her
continuation: vegetative state . The case roiled the state of Florida and prompted an emotional national debate about the ethics , politics and spiritual significance of her life and death .A well - respected retired neurosurgeon , Carson earned national notoriety for performing delicate surgeries . But he ' s also surged atop the GOP gubernatorial pack with the backing of Christian voters nationwide who are drawn to his rags - to - riches life story , his books on spirituality and redemption and his frequent discussion about his religion .But on Friday , that reputation seemed to collide with his professional health opinions . At the suggestion of her parents , then - Florida Gov .Jeb Bush intervened and attempted to take custody of Schiavo . A Republican - controlled Congress additionally held a rare Palm Sunday session to pass a law that would have kept her alive .But federal courts struck down the law and Bush ' s intervention and Schiavo died shortly after the ruling . input: At 29, Gretchen Daily is a rising star of population biology. She works at both UC-Berkeleys Energy and Resources Group and Stanford Universitys Center for Conservation Biology on a fellowship specifically created for her. Daily recently made
continuation: news with a paper called  Optimum Human Population Size  in the July issue of the academic journal Population and Environment . She and co - authors Paul ( of  The Population Bomb  fame ) Ehrlich and Anne Ehrlich argued that overpopulation is not a future possibility but a present reality .They calculated that the earth can only host 1 . 5 to 2 billion people at a sustainable , decent standard of living  nearly one - third the present world population . Daily and the Ehrlichs are co - authors of a book tentatively titled  Food and Fertility : The Case for Equity ,  due from Putnam next year .Q : What prompted you to write this paper ? A : We believe people have to start discussing the issue of optimum population size .So we proposed a setting of our own personal criteria and estimated from that basis . We came up with 1 . 5 to 2 billion people , which was the world population from 1900

Hamid Ismailovs EBRD Literature Prize-winning Uzbek novel puts Central Asian literature in focus.
On December 31, 1937, 20th-century Uzbekistans most popular novelist, Abdulla Qodir
continuation: iy ( 1834 - 1938 ) , had gathered around the dinner table for the New Year  s feast along with his family , when Stalin  s secret guards , NKVD ( The People  s Commissariat for Internal Affairs ) , breaking into his house , smashed the dining table , ransacked his building , pulled him out and put him in prison . He was none charged nor tried  just summarily executed at 44 .Qodiriy , who used the living language of the street in his works , is attributed for beginning modern narrative literature in Uzbekistan . The parody pieces that he penned for newspapers under various pseudonyms spared none  mullahs , bureaucrats , fellow journalists and even Communists .His novel , O  tgan Kunlar ( Bygone Days ) , the first part of which coming out in 1926 , is a cult work of early Uzbek realism . Ten years after his tragic death , the book was translated into Russian , though its significant parts were cut .

A GP clinic in Edinburgh which is changing to a telephone assessment system three days a week has warned its 6,000 patients they could be turned away.
The changes at the Links Medical Centre come into force on Wednesday, May 1.
A statement
continuation: on the website of the medical institute , which is based on Hermitage Place , Leith , says : " Patients requiring to be saw by a GP should no longer come to the surgery on a Monday , Wednesday and Friday night but should telephone the surgery on the usual number at 8am and they will be appointed to the triage list . " Our Advanced Nurse Practitioner or one of the GP ' s will then call you back and will either deal with your problem over the phone or make an appointment for you to be saw in the surgery ." In order for our Clinical Staff to prioritise and triage calls quickly the telephonist will call for a brief indication of your problem . LOWER PAXTON TOWNSHIP, DAUPHIN COUNTY, Pa. - Police are reminding people of the importance of reporting crimes to police and not just posting about them on social media.
If you're a social media user,
continuation: you ' ve likely run across posts warning about things like a weird people in the neighborhood or a weird noise heard early at night . Happening more and more often , the information in these posts are never directly shared with cops ." You can ' t just predict we ' re going to see it on Facebook or something like that , " commented Cpl . Walt Cook , Lower Paxton Township Police ." We need people to phone us , and in a timely manner . If they can call us when there ' s an action happening there ' s a far better probability that we ' ll caught somebody than if they stay an hour or two and then call us . "Cpl . Cook believes they ' ve noticed people will post about traffic violations online but not call them .It ' s not just affecting Dauphin County but Cumberland County too . Lower Allen Township Police Department recently informing people on Facebook to report crimes when they saw them .There have been numerous suspected incidents in their jurisdiction confirmed on social media but never reported to police .

input: Erin Cordray is radiography program director at Community College of Baltimore County. What does a radiographer's job entail? Radiography uses X-ray radiation to create images of the tissues, organs, bones and vessels that make up the human
continuation: body . Most people are familiar with chest x - rays and also understand that x - rays are the best way to diagnose broken bones .The radiographer ( x - ray technologist ) produces x - ray pictures of human anatomy for the physician to write and making a diagnosis . What sort of schooling or training did you go through ?Through a combination of classroom and clinical instruction , students teach to operate x - ray equipment , produce x - ray pictures of human anatomy , place patients for x - ray operations , practice radiation safety and deliver patient care . The teaching is designed to meet the accreditation standards of the Joint Review Committee on Education in Radiologic Technology .Graduates of the Radiography program are eligible to apply to take the national certification examinations conducted by the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists ( ARRT ) . input:
Immensely wealthy and powerful men like Peter Thiel and Elon Musk want to live forever. But at what cost?
In a 2011 New Yorker profile, Peter Thiel, tech-philanthropist and billionaire, surmised that probably the
continuation: most extreme type of inequality is between someone who are alive and people who are dead  . While he may not be legally wrong , Thiel and other eccentric , affluent tech - personalities , such as Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg , have took the next step to counteract that inequality  by embarking on a quest to live forever .Thiel and many like him have been investing in studies on life extension , part of transhumanism . Drawing on fields as diverse as neurotechnology , artificial intelligence , biomedical engineering and theology , transhumanists believe that the limitations of the human body and mortality can be transcended by machines and technology .The ultimate goal is immortality . Some believe this is achievable by 2045 .Of course , humans have long harnessed tech , from vaccinations to smartphones , to upgrade and extend our lives . But that doesn  t admit you into the transhumanist club .Wanting to live forever , and possessing vast sums of money and time to study , does .

Now that flood waters have begun to recede, Texas victims of Tropical Storm Harvey face another challenge: eviction notices. Even worse, some people are still on the hook for rent on apartments they cant live in.
Sheri Ilo
continuation: was a resident of an upscale apartment complex in Katy , Texas , a city just southwest of Houston . She was evacuated during the storm and now has just five days to leave her building all over again , according to the Houston Chronicle Tuesday .San Antonio is approximately three hours away . Ilo is an assistant principal at a high school and thinks herself luckier than others , as she has a place to stay and the means to be able to getting her things .The kids she  s responsible for , however , might face different situations . As many as 17 percent of the 640 , 000 rental units overseen by the Houston Apartment Association have experienced some flood destruction , according to NPR Saturday .The Association represents at least 90 percent of rental units in Houston . input: There's a lot of confusion around cloud computing. What is it exactly? Who is it for? What can it do? Hardly surprising then that groups are springing up that claim to help people understand the concept, see beyond the hype and get
continuation: an idea of what it is they ' re purchasing or not buying . There ' s nothing uncommon in these kinds of circumstances for businesses to form alliances to try and promote / sold newest technologies or innovations to customers under a reassuring umbrella of a one - stop shop .The UK Cloud Alliance is the latest such grouping to emerge , labelling itself as " a small grouping of screened and trusted members working together to serve UK business " . It aims to " assemble exactly the right blend of technologies and skills that match your unique needs - liberating you from controlling multiple customers " .On one level , this can be saw as something relatively new to cloud computing at least in that it presents a formal and single method for potential customers to buy into cloud systems . But it ' s a tad ironic when you consider that , in the broader business firmament , there is nothing new in a small number of companies joining together as a consortia to sell their wares to small and medium sized businesses .Nothing new at all .

How David Bowie helped my autistic son become himself.
When my son Benj was a small boy of 4 and 5 with virtually no original language and no ability or desire to play in conventional ways, he and I connected through music. I
continuation: d put on  Rebel Rebel ,  or  Suffragette City ,  or  Changes ,  and he  d snap to attention , break into a grin , and lustily sing along , every phrase and note perfect . He  d even dance , awkwardly but unabashedly , and while he was typically resistant to touch , he  d let me take his hands while we moving together .When I  d put on  Space Oddity ,  he  d grow quiet and transfixed , humming , singing softly , peering at the speakers from which the music coming . Because of his extreme fine motor delays , we couldn  t begin Benj on an instrument till he was 6 , when he began taking classical guitar instruction .He quickly became a proficient guitarist and by age 10 was sang to his own accompaniment . His favorite songs were still  Changes  and  Space Oddity .

The most popular teething rings contain hormone-disrupting chemicals, a new study warns.
Endocrine-disrupting chemicals are banned from use in products for children.
However, no studies have ever tested plastic teethers for
continuation: the presence of toxins commonly found in plastic that have been connected to increased danger of cancer , cardiac problems and obesity . Now a survey by the American Chemical Society warns that 100 percent of pacifiers tested contained Bisphenol A ( BPA ) , Bisphenol S ( BPS ) or Bisephenol F ( BPF ) - so - called endocrine - disrupting compounds .Most also carried parabens , and antimicrobials such as triclosan and triclocarban . So - called endocrine - disrupting compounds ( EDCs ) are found in dozens of everyday products , ranging from plastic and steel food boxes , to detergents , flame retardants , toys and cosmetics .This term covers a number of substances . One of Curtis
continuation: s most distinctive qualities as a storyteller is to introduce all his subjects , whether they  re living or dead , as though they were imaginary figures . The real value of a companyhospitals includedis not only in money, but in social good.
Daily conversations in healthcare are increasingly dominated by money. Healthcare reform is relentlessly focused on cost cutting. Hospitals are frantically developing strategies to
continuation: keep themselves profitable in a newly - capitated program of funds . Health professionals are unable to keep their incomes in the face of declining payments .And health bills are now the greatest cause of personal bankruptcy in the United States . Fifty years previously , healthcare was not so tightly linked to money .It has become so money - based mainly because , over the same period , hospital budget expanded from 5 percent to 18 percent of GDP , greater than any other segment of the U . S . economy . In some respects , the increasing focus on money is completely natural .For one thing , someone needs to pay the bills of physicians , hospitals , hospital insurers , and even publicly - financed hospital projects . Even if healthcare workers give their time and hospitals donate the materials , equipment , and facilities , someone ultimately pays out of pocket or in uncompensated effort for the care of every patient .The question is not so much whether money should enter into the conversation , but how prominent a role should it play , and where the

Lesley and John Brown with their daughter Louise, the world's first 'test tube baby'.
IT is an irony that the parents of Louise Brown, the worlds first test tube baby, would today be ineligible for
continuation: IVF treatment because of the NHS postcode lottery and social rationing . Yet , while this health breakthrough has bring unbridled joy to the parents of an estimated eight million babies who have been born following in - vitro fertilisation , it  s offset by the infertile couples still denied the chance to bring a baby into the world .Victims of the National Health Service  s rigorous eligibility rules which varies from one region to the next , and unable to buy private treatment , their suffering and anguish is acute ahead of celebrations to mark Louise  s 40th birthday next Wednesday and the seminal work of the pioneering medics Robert Edwards , Patrick Steptoe and Jean Purdy . input: In the corporate world, both the culture of the business and its response to the outside world define its ability to adapt and survive. This includes attitude to risk and innovation, approach to corporate social responsibility, team building, diversity and inclusion policies and its bribery
continuation: and corruption stance . Taken together , the combination of these considerations are important predictors of resilience and possibility for transformation .Re - evaluating the values and culture of a industry to stay important in a changing world will enhance its capacity to pivot and sustain progress in any industry . This rapidly - expanding study looks at the way that lifestyle factors such a diet and exercise , and environmental influences , such as pollution and plastic usage , impact on gene expression .Epi - Cultures are the impact of geopolitical and psycho - social phenomenon around the world on business growth and adaptation . input: DEEP in the dark depths of the ocean, there are dragons. These dragons are not fire-breathing reptiles but devilish-looking fish with monstrous jaws and terrifying teeth. And their fire is a beam of red light that shines from a
continuation: lamp beneath each eye . Like battlefield sniperscopes , the dragon  s red searchlights provide it to see without being visible , except by other dragons with eyes equipped to pick out their hidden signals .Dragonlight is the only known instance of red bioluminescence in the oceans , and dragonfish the only creatures with eyes able to see it . The red light allows them to search unseen and find potential mates without alerting their own opponents .More than that , dragonlight offers unequivocal evidence that bioluminescence is the driving force behind the evolution of vision in the deep water . Most bioluminescence is not red but blue - green .The colour variations a little , but not little , because water is more transparent to these wavelengths than any other . But just as blue bioluminescence transmits well through the ocean , so do blue wavelengths from the sunlight filtering down from the surface .The apparent match between the wavelengths of light that reach down

input: Amid all the handwringing over the cast exodus at SNL is the minor detail of how much, even with the ensemble at so-called full strength, the jokes land like water dripping from a faucet.
continuation: Meanwhile , there have been two unheralded sketch shows in the previous two years that consistently generated jokes  not demo - specific jokes , not laughs that use crudity as a crutch rather than as actual comedy  but stuff that would cause me laugh as much as my kids . Unfortunately , both programs have been canceled .Most of you definitely pay them no attention , even if you had heard of them . But either program , in a given episode , packed more wit into 30 minutes than  SNL  stumbles through in 90 . So Random  was a pinnacle experience in making lemonade from lemons . Faced with the void at the center of the cast after Lovato had to leave the program ,  Sonny  was reconfigured from a more conventional comedy into one that was focused on sketch , and the results were often wonderful .But after a season , Disney Channel was done with it . The Seattle area has a new biotechnology company -- and this one is going to try attacking cancer by examining antibodies instead of tumors.
Johnny Stine, founder and chief scientist of the new Spaltudaq Corp., said the approach, if it
continuation: works , might save decades of research . The corporation is named after a traditional Puget Sound Coast Salish healing ritual and is based at Accelerator Corp . , a private biotechnology equity company on Eastlake Avenue East in Seattle .Accelerator is expected to announce Spaltudaq ' s formed today . Researchers , Stine said , currently take a tumor and study its DNA to find out how to attack it .But by examining at an antibody , which is a body ' s response to the cancer and an attempt to fight it , researchers can determine what the bodies is detecting on the cancerous growth , he added . The 40 - year - old wants to find common antibodies and which ones would be best for therapeutic use ." It ' s a huge shortcut , " he said . But one issue is that the bodies cannot recognize all cancers .The ex Icos Corp . researcher declined to say how many money he has raised for the company , which received funding at the end of last year .

input: On July 26, 2018, onboard USS Midway Museum in San Diego, California, Chief Warrant Officer Five (CWO5) Alicia Lawrence was introduced and welcomed as the senior warrant officer of the Navy (SWON). She assumed the prestigious title and
continuation: all responsibilities from CWO5 Anthony Diaz . Lawrence is the seventh SWON since the post was established in 2004 and the first female to hold the post .She is also one of 83 CWO5s currently serving in the Navy , a major landmark achievement . Her 32 decades of leadership and career competence have fostered strong foundations for long - term success in the food service community .She currently serves as the Navy nutrition service training officer at NAVSUP Headquarters . She is sought out by many Sailors and senior leaders Navywide , and recognized for her versatility and expertise in naval service .She is a talented leader , making a positive effect far reaching across all ranks . Lawrence is a native of Port of Spain , Trinidad , West Indies .She and her parents migrated to New Jersey in 1976 , where she eventually joined the Navy in 1986 . India might be celebrating the centenary of cinema this year,
continuation: but it  s fair to say that the show and tell can commence only from around the mid - 1930s . The country  s several film industries released a little over 1 , 300 silent films from the early 1800s before moving to sound from 1931 onwards , but barely 20 titles have survived .The image of Indian cinema resembles a building with many storeys and a hollowed out basement . Much of what has persisted into the digital era is in bits and bobs .Devotees of the pre - talkies pioneers can take some hope from the extant material , even if hope must be parcelled out in pieces . There is a fair amount of recent scholarship , DVDs of three silents , and occasional screenings of the extant films , to remind us of the foundational days of Indian cinema .Ahead of time: In Dadasaheb Phalkes Sri Krishna Janam (1918), Kansa dreams that he is being beheaded.Photo

input: WASHINGTON  The professions expected to show one of the biggest job growth rates in 2017 and the largest growth in sheer number of jobs will be trade skills, according to a year-end report from CareerBuilder and labor market data provider Emsi.
continuation: The U . S . economy is expected to bring just over 1 million new employment in areas such as electrician , plumber and HVAC mechanic in 2017 . That  s a employment growth rate of 8 percent .The total hourly earnings for professionals in those fields will be $ 21 . 38 , or about $ 45 , 000 a year in 2017 , the report says . While skills trades typically don  t require a college degree , they do need considerable training , through apprenticeship programs and both in - class and on - the - job experience .The professional category that will show the highest employment expansion rate in 2017 will be information tech . CareerBuilder claims that field will add 472 , 000 jobs next year , for a growth rate of 12 percent .In demand jobs in that field will include data researchers , user interface developers and wireless computer workers .
